title: New network calendar event, very slow to update on calendar view
content:
Hi,

I am using a network calendar (Thunderbird build-in, no add-ons) with "Offline support" installed on premises (NextCloud). The calendar works perfectly, updating network calendar as needed.

When I create a new event and press [Save and Close] button, the dialog box closes, but the event takes about 25-35 seconds to appear on the calendar.

When I delete the event it takes about 12-15 seconds to disappear from the view.

If the calendar is local (on the computer) the event appears immediately on the calendar view.

I presume that this has to do with the network update procedure. Is there a way (or an option) that would show the event immediately on the view and make the update on the background later on ?

My Thunderbird version is 115.1.0 (64-bit) installed on Microsoft Windows 11.

Thank you
creator: EmmanuelT

title: Unable to accept appointment updates since Supernova update
content:
I am able to accept invitations "This message contains an appointment invitation", with the regular action buttons.

But if it comes to appointment update messages, I have no action buttons. Only the message "Diese Nachricht enthält eine Termineinladung".

Please see the screenshots.
creator: thomas116

title: Move my current email address content and files to a new email address, deleting the old email
content:
I think it is called a "profile" based on your website that needs to be migrated to a new email address. I have had an email address for 25 years however in "the divorce" it is being deleted. I would like to transfer all the saved files and any content to a new email address. Also set up a new thunderbird account which I will pay for directly.

The current email is: revasanchez@earthlink.net
creator: revsan

title: Update problems from TB pre-115 to 115. How to convert filterlists?
content:
On Windows, the updater from Thunderbird didnt update at all. You need to manually download the new exe and do it there, pretty weird.

On Linux, the Flatpak updates normally. But having a really old profile seems to break things, my inbox was gone from the "bundled folders" view, so I set up a new profile again (using the -p argument, this is non standard!)

So now: How do I export:

  • contacts
  • filters
  • accounts
  • set up calendars
  • custom local folders
  • local mails
  • ...

from one Thunderbird to another? This is not especially my problem, but its a general one and its important.

I simply need a way to export my filters, as I dont want to make them again. The rest is already done, except contacts, where I have no idea how they are actually used and it never worked for me.

Using the Flatpak from Flathub on Fedora Linux
creator: hjfw783534iege

title: How to export in MBOX format in Supernova v115.1.0
content: Running Thunderbird Supernova v115.1.0 I can import an MBOX file by simply copying the file into my Local Folders folder. I'd like to be able to export messages in a selected folder in MBOX format too but, if there is a way to do so, I've been unable to find it. Older questions refer to the use of an add-on named 'ImportExportTools NG' but the add-on manager in v115 tells me that add-on is not compatible.
creator: ChuckoW

title: Today pane
content:
Hello Does anyone know why the Today Pane on the right keeps disappearing after I've activated it. It does not disappear immediately but at some time later. I have to tick (activate it) every couple of days.

Thanks

title: gmail - chyba autorizace
content: Přeji hezký den! Používám Thunderbird na práci s poštou gmail mnoho let. Letos v červnu (květen) se přestal thunderbird přihlašovat k gmailu a píše mi to chyba autorizace. Vše jsem kontroloval i na gmail konzoli a aplikace Thunderbird je povolená... Jaké nastavení mi opět umožní používat klineta pro gmail? Petr Borek jampb@centrum.cz

title: problem synchronizing sent emails.
content:
I have recently set up an outlook email account with thuntherbird (default configuration), however I am having problems with the synchronization of sent emails.

When I set up the account, it did not sync any of the sent mail that I already had in my account.

When sending mail from thuntherbird, it does sync with the outlook server (if I log into the account from outlook I see the mail sent from thuntherbird), however if I send mail from outlook, it does not sync with Thuntherbird.

thank you for your help
creator: cortegazarraga

title: TB 115.1.0 new calendar entry has a shift of +9hrs
content:

If I enter an entry using my Mobile and talke a look in TB calendar, the entry is correct.

In Settings all timezones seems to be correct (System: UTC+1)

Any hints? Thanks for support, Christian
